diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of Cronkhite–Canada syndrome was supported by the presence of persistent diarrhea, weight loss, anemia, evidence of malabsorption, and the development of ectodermal changes such as alopecia and onychodystrophy. Biopsy findings showed characteristic hamartomatous polyps and other mucosal abnormalities, while initial investigations had not revealed the cause, prompting repeated evaluations leading to the final diagnosis.
